title: China Awards 50 Scholarships to Sierra Leonean Students (Linked to Project #44564)
description: August 2015, the Chinese government announced that it had raised the number of scholarships for Sierra Leonean students from 35 to 50. This year also marked the continuation of the scholarship program after it was halted due to the Ebola epidemic in West Africa. The financial amount of the scholarships is unknown.
staff_comments: This appears to be an annually occurring program (see project ID #44564).
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Awards 50 Scholarships to Sierra Leonean Students (Linked to Project #44564)

# Description
August 2015, the Chinese government announced that it had raised the number of scholarships for Sierra Leonean students from 35 to 50. This year also marked the continuation of the scholarship program after it was halted due to the Ebola epidemic in West Africa. The financial amount of the scholarships is unknown.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Education sector, scholarship program for students, no energy or infrastructure components

title: China Awards 7,000 Scholarships for Young Professionals from Sierra Leone
description: On October 1, 2015, the Chinese president, Xi Jinping, announced that China would award Sierra Leone with 7,000 scholarships for young professionals to study in China. This is part of a project awarding 35,000 scholarships to students across Africa. Cost of the project is unknown. Project status is also unknown but it is most likely complete
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Awards 7,000 Scholarships for Young Professionals from Sierra Leone

# Description
On October 1, 2015, the Chinese president, Xi Jinping, announced that China would award Sierra Leone with 7,000 scholarships for young professionals to study in China. This is part of a project awarding 35,000 scholarships to students across Africa. Cost of the project is unknown. Project status is also unknown but it is most likely complete
justification: Project focuses on education and human development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 7,000 scholarships for young professionals, part of broader African education initiative

title: China donated anti-Ebola materials to Sierra Leone
description: On March 13, 2015, China donated a batch of anti-Ebola materials to Sierra Leone. Zhao Yanbo, Ambassador of Sierra Leone, and Koroma, President of Serbia, attended the handover ceremony.  Ambassador Zhao and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Health Savi signed anti-epidemic materials handover certificates on behalf of the two governments.
staff_comments: This project is not to be confused with #62556 because the handover date is different.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donated anti-Ebola materials to Sierra Leone

# Description
On March 13, 2015, China donated a batch of anti-Ebola materials to Sierra Leone. Zhao Yanbo, Ambassador of Sierra Leone, and Koroma, President of Serbia, attended the handover ceremony.  Ambassador Zhao and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Health Savi signed anti-epidemic materials handover certificates on behalf of the two governments.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-Ebola materials, healthcare sector focus

title: China provides anti-Ebola training program in Sierra Leone
description: On January 6, 2015, China launched the Anti-Ebola Training Program in Sierra Leone. Chinese Ambassador Zhao Yanbo, Ambassador of Sierra Leone attended the launching ceremony. Since the Ebola outbreak, China has provided all-round support. Up to the launch of this project, Chinese public health experts have trained more than 2,300 people in Sierra Leone.   This intensive training project will further penetrate the grassroots level, and in the three administrative villages of Zhuyi, Corso, and Grafton, systematically help the grassroots to enhance their current anti-epidemic capabilities and their ability to respond to other infectious diseases in the future.  The current status of the project is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China provides anti-Ebola training program in Sierra Leone

# Description
On January 6, 2015, China launched the Anti-Ebola Training Program in Sierra Leone. Chinese Ambassador Zhao Yanbo, Ambassador of Sierra Leone attended the launching ceremony. Since the Ebola outbreak, China has provided all-round support. Up to the launch of this project, Chinese public health experts have trained more than 2,300 people in Sierra Leone.   This intensive training project will further penetrate the grassroots level, and in the three administrative villages of Zhuyi, Corso, and Grafton, systematically help the grassroots to enhance their current anti-epidemic capabilities and their ability to respond to other infectious diseases in the future.  The current status of the project is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on public health training and epidemic response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Anti-Ebola training program, public health focus, infectious disease response training

title: Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to Sierra Leone-China Friendship Hospital
description: China has been sending medical teams to Sierra Leone from Hunan Province since 1973. China stopped sending medical teams in 1993 due to civil conflict and political instability. However, it began sending teams again in 2002. On November 4th and 6th, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed an exchange of letters, dispatching the 17th Chinese medical team to Sierra Leone. The 10-member team was stationed at the Sierra Leone-China Friendship Hospital in the town of Jui. It completed its term of service between late 2015 and 2016.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to Sierra Leone-China Friendship Hospital

# Description
China has been sending medical teams to Sierra Leone from Hunan Province since 1973. China stopped sending medical teams in 1993 due to civil conflict and political instability. However, it began sending teams again in 2002. On November 4th and 6th, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed an exchange of letters, dispatching the 17th Chinese medical team to Sierra Leone. The 10-member team was stationed at the Sierra Leone-China Friendship Hospital in the town of Jui. It completed its term of service between late 2015 and 2016.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Dispatch of medical team to hospital, healthcare focus

title: [EBOLA] China donates equipments and cash worth $1.854 million to Sierra Leone for combating Ebola
description: On January 15, 2015, the Chinese embassy donated on behalf of the Chinese government $500,000 in cash, 15 pick-up trucks and 200 motorbikes worth $ 1 million, and 215 sets of medical protective equipment worth $354,000 thousand to Sierra Leone in response to the Ebola epidemic, according to the Chinese Embassy in Sierra Leone and Chinese Ministry of Commerce.   These donations will help the Sierra Leonean government strengthen social mobilization, Ebola case management and surveillance.  Ernest Bai Koroma,President of Sierra Leone, accepted the aid and Samura Kamara, Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, signed the hand-over certificate.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
[EBOLA] China donates equipments and cash worth $1.854 million to Sierra Leone for combating Ebola

# Description
On January 15, 2015, the Chinese embassy donated on behalf of the Chinese government $500,000 in cash, 15 pick-up trucks and 200 motorbikes worth $ 1 million, and 215 sets of medical protective equipment worth $354,000 thousand to Sierra Leone in response to the Ebola epidemic, according to the Chinese Embassy in Sierra Leone and Chinese Ministry of Commerce.   These donations will help the Sierra Leonean government strengthen social mobilization, Ebola case management and surveillance.  Ernest Bai Koroma,President of Sierra Leone, accepted the aid and Samura Kamara, Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, signed the hand-over certificate.
justification: Project focuses on emergency response and healthcare support without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of medical equipment, vehicles, and cash for Ebola response, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China donates anti-malarial drugs to Sierra Leone
description: On May 13, 2015, the Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone, Zhao Yanbo, signed a handover certificate with Sierra Leone's Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Health and Sanitation to for anti-malarial drugs in Freetown, according to the Chinese Embassy in Sierra Leone and Chinese Ministry of Commerce.

evidence: Donation of anti-malarial drugs, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government provides container inspection equipment and remote monitoring system to enhance revenue collection (Linked to Project ID#62872)
description: In early June 2015, the Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone, Zhao Yanbo, and Sierra Leone’s Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Samura Kamara, signed a grant agreement for the provision of a container inspection equipment and a remote monitoring system. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The purpose of this grant was to enhance the customs clearance and revenue collection capabilities of Sierra Leone’s National Revenue Authority (NRA).    Nuctech Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. The container inspection equipment arrived in Sierra Leone in September 2015. Also, through this project, Sierra Leonean customs staff were trained at the Customs Administration Academy in China on how to operate container scanners and analyze images.  Nuctech Co., Ltd. installed the donated container inspection equipment at the Gbalamuya Customs Post. On January 19, 2017, a project handover ceremony was held.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides container inspection equipment and remote monitoring system to enhance revenue collection (Linked to Project ID#62872)

# Description
In early June 2015, the Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone, Zhao Yanbo, and Sierra Leone’s Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Samura Kamara, signed a grant agreement for the provision of a container inspection equipment and a remote monitoring system. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The purpose of this grant was to enhance the customs clearance and revenue collection capabilities of Sierra Leone’s National Revenue Authority (NRA).    Nuctech Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. The container inspection equipment arrived in Sierra Leone in September 2015. Also, through this project, Sierra Leonean customs staff were trained at the Customs Administration Academy in China on how to operate container scanners and analyze images.  Nuctech Co., Ltd. installed the donated container inspection equipment at the Gbalamuya Customs Post. On January 19, 2017, a project handover ceremony was held.
justification: Project focuses on customs and trade infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Container inspection equipment, remote monitoring system, customs training, focus on revenue collection

title: China donates 150 books authored by Xi Jinping to members and staff of Sierra Leone Parliament
description: During the third session of Parliament (December 5, 2014 - December 9, 2015), the Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone donated 150 books written by Xi Jinping to the members and staff of the Sierra Leone Parliament.
staff_comments: The date of the donation is unknown; the project may have occurred in late 2014 rather than 2015.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donates 150 books authored by Xi Jinping to members and staff of Sierra Leone Parliament

# Description
During the third session of Parliament (December 5, 2014 - December 9, 2015), the Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone donated 150 books written by Xi Jinping to the members and staff of the Sierra Leone Parliament.
justification: Book donation is a cultural/social development activity with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 150 books to parliament members and staff, no energy-related components

title: Chinese embassy donates consignments to Badbaado Orphanage Center in Mogadishu, Somalia
description: In June 2015, according to the Chinese embassy in Somalia, Wei Hongtian, the Chinese Ambassador to Somalia, donated blankets, chairs, tables, backpacks, and educational supplies the Badbaado Orphanage Center in Mogadishu, which houses 121 orphans. The Embassy supports the program through the “China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Action” Program. Mohamed Omar Dalha, Deputy Chairman of the Committee of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Federal Parliament of Somalia, and some representatives from local community attended the hand-over ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese embassy donates consignments to Badbaado Orphanage Center in Mogadishu, Somalia

# Description
In June 2015, according to the Chinese embassy in Somalia, Wei Hongtian, the Chinese Ambassador to Somalia, donated blankets, chairs, tables, backpacks, and educational supplies the Badbaado Orphanage Center in Mogadishu, which houses 121 orphans. The Embassy supports the program through the “China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Action” Program. Mohamed Omar Dalha, Deputy Chairman of the Committee of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Federal Parliament of Somalia, and some representatives from local community attended the hand-over ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of basic supplies to an orphanage, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of blankets, chairs, tables, backpacks, and educational supplies to orphanage center
